title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
description: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

items.content_html:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Connectors product of Oracle MySQL (component: Connector/J). Supported versions that are affected are 8.1.0 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Connectors. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker and while the vulnerability is in MySQL Connectors, attacks may significantly impact additional products (scope change). Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of MySQL Connectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22102
  • https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2023.html
  • https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20231027-0007
  • https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j/compare/8.1.0...8.2.0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6vm-37g8-gqvh
items.title: [com.mysql:mysql-connector-java] MySQL Connectors takeover vulnerability

items.content_html:
FitNesse all releases allows a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-28125
  • https://github.com/unclebob/fitnesse
  • https://github.com/unclebob/fitnesse/blob/master/SECURITY.md
  • https://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN94521208
  • http://fitnesse.org/FitNesseDownload
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x9r9-48rm-4xm6
items.title: [org.fitnesse:fitnesse] FitNesse allows execution of arbitrary OS commands

items.content_html:
Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Liferay Portal prior to 7.2.1 CE GA2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via JSON web services (JSONWS).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7961
  • https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities
  • https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/id/117954271
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157254/Liferay-Portal-Java-Unmarshalling-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158392/Liferay-Portal-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • https://research.checkpoint.com/2021/freakout-leveraging-newest-vulnerabilities-for-creating-a-botnet
  • https://github.com/liferay/liferay-portal/blob/7.2.1-ga2/portal-kernel/bnd.bnd
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w7pm-cc4v-f3g8
items.title: [com.liferay.portal:com.liferay.portal.kernel] Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Liferay Portal

items.content_html:
When reading a specially crafted JPEG file, metadata-extractor up to 2.16.0 can be made to allocate large amounts of memory that finally leads to an out-of-memory error even for very small inputs. This could be used to mount a denial of service attack against services that use metadata-extractor library.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24614
  • https://github.com/drewnoakes/metadata-extractor/issues/561
  • https://github.com/drewnoakes/metadata-extractor/pull/570
  • https://github.com/drewnoakes/metadata-extractor/commit/85ec243df54133a87f9d928d2278595f52b07519
  • https://github.com/drewnoakes/metadata-extractor/releases/tag/2.18.0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4v6p-cxf9-98rf
items.title: [com.drewnoakes:metadata-extractor] Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling in metadata-extractor

items.content_html: A Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) injection vulnerability in Swagger UI before 3.23.11 allows attackers to use the Relative Path Overwrite (RPO) technique to perform CSS-based input field value exfiltration, such as exfiltration of a CSRF token value. In other words, this product intentionally allows the embedding of untrusted JSON data from remote servers, but it was not previously known that
items.title: [io.springfox:springfox-swagger-ui] Cross-site scripting in Swagger-UI

In other words, this product intentionally allows the embedding of untrusted JSON data from remote servers, but it was not previously known that
items.title: [org.webjars.npm:swagger-ui] Cross-site scripting in Swagger-UI

items.content_html:
Applications that use spring-boot-loader or spring-boot-loader-classic and contain custom code that performs signature verification of nested jar files may be vulnerable to signature forgery where content that appears to have been signed by one signer has, in fact, been signed by another.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38807
  • https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38807
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7cj3-x93g-gj76
items.title: [org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-loader-classic] Signature forgery in Spring Boot's Loader

items.content_html:
The Apache Helix Front (UI) component contained a hard-coded secret, allowing an attacker to spoof sessions by generating their own fake cookies.

This issue affects Apache Helix Front (UI): all versions.

As this project is retired, we do not plan to release a version that fixes this issue. Users are recommended to find an alternative or restrict access to the instance to trusted users.

NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-22281
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/zt26fpmrqx3fzcy8nv3b43kb3xllo5ny
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6247-7862-q2pq
items.title: [org.apache.helix:helix] Apache Helix Front (UI) component contained a hard-coded secret

items.content_html:
Mysql security vulnerability in Apache SeaTunnel.

Attackers can read files on the MySQL server by modifying the information in the MySQL URL

allowLoadLocalInfile=true&allowUrlInLocalInfile=true&allowLoadLocalInfileInPath=/&maxAllowedPacket=655360 This issue affects Apache SeaTunnel: 1.0.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version [1.0.1], which fixes the issue.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-49198
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/48j9f1nsn037mgzc4j9o51nwglb1s08h
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8m84-h9hh-3cfh
items.title: [org.apache.seatunnel:seatunnel] Apache SeaTunnel SQL Injection vulnerability
